data.name: Eye-Level Angle
data.description: Aligns the viewer's perspective with the scene, offering a natural view.

data.name: Low Angle
data.description: Camera below eye level, looking up. Makes buildings look imposing.

data.name: High Angle
data.description: Camera above the scene, providing an overview of interior layout or building structure.

data.name: Bird's-Eye View
data.description: Extreme high angle, showing top view of a structure or interior.

data.name: Worm's-Eye View
data.description: Extreme low angle from ground level, creating a sense of awe for tall structures.

data.name: Oblique Angle
data.description: Camera is tilted, making vertical lines appear at an angle.

data.name: Dutch Angle
data.description: Similar to oblique angle but more extreme, creating a sense of disorientation.

data.name: Wide Shot
data.description: Captures a broad view, useful for entire buildings or large interior spaces.

data.name: Close-Up
data.description: Focuses on specific architectural or interior details.

data.name: Panoramic View
data.description: Wide, unbroken view for capturing landscapes or large structures.
